name: FAMOTIDINE
cautions:
Cautions 
(From 1.3.1 H2-receptor antagonists: British National Formulary)
Cautions H2-receptor antagonists might mask symptoms of gastric cancer; particular care is required in patients presenting with ‘alarm features’ (see Dyspepsia), in such cases gastric malignancy should be ruled out before treatment.; interactions: Appendix 1 (histamine H2-antagonists)
and notes above
side-effects:
Side-effects see notes above; also constipation; less
commonly dry mouth, nausea, vomiting, flatulence, taste disorders,
anorexia, fatigue; very rarely chest tightness, interstitial
pneumonia, seizures, paraesthesia
doses:
Benign gastric and duodenal ulceration, treatment, 40 mg
at night for 4–8 weeks; maintenance (duodenal ulceration), 20 mg at
night

Reflux oesophagitis, 20–40 mg twice daily for 6–12 weeks; maintenance,
20 mg twice daily
pregnancy:
Pregnancy manufacturer advises avoid unless potential benefit
outweighs risk
